page.title: 12THE GROWTH OF A TRADITION
page.content: Twenty five years ago the teenagers of the recently formed Cubbington Methodist Youth Church staged the pantomime 'Dick Whittington'. Using hired costumes and home-made scenery it was staged in the Village Hall, and was a great success. The panto became an annual event, moving in 1966 to the Methodist Church's new hall, on a well equipped stage paid for by the efforts of the youngsters. The club changed its name, and leaders came and went, but the panto went on, always traditional in style, full of music and laughter, and aimed firmly at the children in the front rows. This year's performance of 'Sinbad' will notch up a quarter of a century of Youth Group pantos. Long may they continue.
